model

Class ScoreCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ScoreCard

  • public class ScoreCard
extends java.lang.Object
    ScoreCard keeps track of results of previous games. It checks if a ScoreCard object exists and if it does it loads these previous scores. It has a default path to this object but can be instantiated with another path. If the object is not found, it starts with a blank ScoreCard. If the path is invalid and scores can not be saved it will not handle the exception and not effect game play. Custom paths are not saved, only the scores are serialized.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScoreCard()
      If no path is given ScoreCard uses a hard-written default path.
      ScoreCard(java.lang.String path)
      The path variable indicates where the serialized score object should be saved and retrieved.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String readScore()
      Returns the previous results of games as a String.
      void writeScore(java.lang.String s)
      Takes the results of a game as a String parameter, and saves them to the ScoreCard.
